name: Yousuf Karsh
bio: Armenian-Canadian photographer known for his portraits of notable individuals.

name: Johannes Vermeer
bio: Dutch painter considered to be one of the greatest artists of the Dutch Golden Age.

name: Katsushika Hokusai
bio: An ukiyo-e artist of the Edo period. Hokusai evolved ukiyo-e into a style that focused on nature. He was an inspiration for Vincent van Gogh and Claude Monet.

name: Pieter Bruegel the Elder
bio: Important figure in the Dutch and Flemish Renaissance painting movement.

name: William Anders
bio: United States Air Force major general, electrical engineer, nuclear engineer, NASA astronaut, and businessman. He was part of the Apollo 8 mission, becoming one of the first people to leave Earth's orbit.

name: Ansel Adams
bio: Landscape photographer and environmentalist known for his black-and-white images of the American West.

name: John Lewis Krimmel
bio: Born in the Holy Roman Empire, Krimmel became America's first painter of genre scenes.

name: Bartolom√© Esteban Murillo
bio: Spanish painter known both for his religious paintings and his portraits of the good and the bad of everyday life.

name: Pierre-Auguste Renoir
bio: French artist important in the development of Impressionism. His paintings highlight feminity and beauty.

name: Hubble Space Telescope
bio: Space telescope launched by NASS in 1990. It's one of NASA's Great Observatories.

name: Themistokles von Eckenbrecher
bio: German landscape and marine artist, his paintings were influenced by the Romantic movement.

name: Carlos de Haes
bio: Spanish painter born in Belgium, known for the realism in his landscape paintings

name: Neil Armstrong
bio: The first person to walk on the Moon. Armstrong was an astronaut, naval aviator, test pilot, aeronautical engineer, and university professor.
